movies.title: The Aggression Scale
movies.plot: When out-on-bail mob boss Bellavance discovers that $500,000 of his money is missing, he sends four hardcore hit men to send a "loud and messy" message to the suspected thieves' families. But when the killers invade the Rutledge home, they'll meet the household's emotionally disturbed young son Owen. Owen has a history of violent behavior, knows how to make lethal booby-traps and is about to teach these thugs some deadly lessons in extreme vengeance.
movies.simplePlot: Four heavily armed hitmen and two unusual teenagers go to war over $500,000 of stolen cash.

biography.bio: Ryan Hartwig is an actor and producer, known for The Aggression Scale (2012), Last Vegas (2013) and Just Before I Go (2014).
biography.name: Ryan Hartwig

biography.bio: Fabianne Therese was born in Kansas City, Missouri, USA as Fabianne Therese Gstottenmayr. She is an actress, known for Teenage Cocktail (2016), The Skinny (2016) and Southbound (2015).
biography.name: Fabianne Therese

biography.bio: Raymond Herbert "Ray" Wise (born August 20, 1947) is an American actor. Some of his best-known roles include Leland Palmer in Twin Peaks (1990), henchman Leon C. Nash in RoboCop (1987), Jack Taggart Sr. in Jeepers Creepers II (2003), the Devil in the CW television series Reaper (2007), Donald Wadsworth in Suburban Gothic (2014). Wise was born in Akron, Ohio, graduated from Garfield High School in 1964 and attended Kent State University in Kent, Ohio. He is of Romanian descent on his mother's side.
biography.name: Ray Wise

biography.bio: Growing up in San Diego, becoming an actor came naturally to Dana Ashbrook. His father is the director of the Palomar College Department of Performing Arts, and his mother is a teacher who performs in local theater. His sisters, Daphne Ashbrook and Taylor Ashbrook, are also working actresses. His own career started while still in his teens, when his sister Daphne's agent saw him performing in a high school play, and he made a good impression. He started out with guest appearances in TV series, and then went on to supporting roles in motion pictures. His big break was in 1990 in winning the role of Bobby Briggs in the offbeat television series Twin Peaks (1990). Ashbrook's intense portrayal of the volatile tempered high school athlete with his shaggy hair, soulful appearance, and intense personality made an impression. After the show went off the air the following year, he continued to make appearances in television and film. In 1997, he won a starring role in the series Crisis Center (1997), but in spite of its promise, the series only lasted one season. Ashbrook made a comeback in 2002 when he was cast in a recurring role playing the slimy and greedy stockbroker Rich Rinaldi, a character the viewers loved to hate, in the popular teen soap opera Dawson's Creek (1998) during the show's final season. In his spare time, he plays basketball and tennis. He is also an accomplished harmonica player.
biography.name: Dana Ashbrook

biography.bio: Derek Mears was born on April 29, 1972 in Bakersfield, California, USA. He is known for his work on Hansel & Gretel: Witch Hunters (2013), Predators (2010) and Friday the 13th (2009). He was previously married to Jennifer Flack.
biography.name: Derek Mears

biography.bio: Jacob Reynolds has been acting since he was 4 years old. He started with a commercial for Ritz Crackers. He holds his pilot's rating in multi-engine commercial land aircraft.
biography.name: Jacob Reynolds

biography.bio: Born in Yakima, Washington, Joseph moved to Anchorage, Alaska at a young age where he was raised by his mother Jane. Looking for a warmer climate he moved to Colorado. While studying finance at Colorado State University, Joseph returned to Alaska every summer to work as a gold miner at the Valdez Creek Gold Mine to earn his tuition. During his last year of school he discovered acting by landing the role of David Kingsley in the play 'Stage Door'. As the Head Of Production at Windowseat Films, Joseph McKelheer oversees all production efforts and execution in the Film, TV and Commercial departments. Most recently Joseph produced The Adderall Diaries starring James Franco, Amber Heard and Ed Harris. Joseph also co-produced Barely Lethal, starring Samuel Jackson and Jessica Alba. As the founder of Film Harvest, Joseph produced an impressive slate of independent films including The Hammer, which won the Audience Award at eight film festivals, a title he also wrote. Under the Film Harvest banner Joseph also produced Free Samples, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Jess Weixler and Tippe Hedren. Other narrative features titles include: Chasing The Devil, The Thompsons, The Aggression Scale and Godspeed. In addition to these films, Joseph also produced Fight Church, a documentary directed by Academy Award winner Dan Junge and chronicling the movement of MMA-style fighting in the nation's church communities. In addition to producing television pilots and series for Hulu and Comedy Central, McKelheer also has live broadcasting experience directing and producing live sports for Fox Sports West.
biography.name: Joseph McKelheer

biography.bio: Boyd Kestner was born on November 23, 1964 in Virginia, USA. He is an actor and writer, known for Hannibal (2001), Black Hawk Down (2001) and Appaloosa (2008).
biography.name: Boyd Kestner

biography.bio: Lisa Rotondi was born on December 6, 1972 in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA. She is an actress and writer, known for Jerry Maguire (1996), The Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human (1999) and The Aggression Scale (2012).
biography.name: Lisa Rotondi

biography.bio: Kostbar was the writer/producer of the film, The Hammer, "A hidden gem" by the Los Angeles Times; based on the life of Deaf UFC fighter, Matt Hamill. The film premiered at AFI Fest and won The Breakthrough Audience Award and was released theatrically and DVD/VOD. He later produced The Aggression Scale, which premiered at the South by Southwest Film Festival and was released by Anchor Bay. Kostbar went on to produce Free Samples, with notable cast, Jesse Eisenberg, Jason Ritter and Tippi Hedren, as well as, cinematographer, Reed Marano. The film premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival and was released by Starz. He followed up with the international production, The Thompsons, a sequel to cult classic, The Hamiltons. The film was directed by The Butcher Brothers and was released by Lionsgate. Kostbar's most recent films are Fight Church, directed by Academy/Emmy Award Winner, Daniel Junge and Bryan Storkel which was released by Netflix/Lionsgate, HBO/Funny or Die "Ferrell Takes the Field" and HBO/Film 45 "The Promoter" to be released later this year. In addition to his film pursuits, Kostbar has produced or line produced many other features, televisions shows, web series such as the recently released Youtube Red series, "Single by 30" and the Verizon Go90 series "Algorhythm". He has also produced several commercials, branded videos and music videos for companies such as HBO, Comedy Central, Hulu, Funny or Die, Film 45, YouTube, Verizon Go90, Fullscreen, Big Breakfast/College Humor, New Form Digital, Defy Media, Warner Bros Records, Epic, XIX Entertainment, Snowfort Pictures, Dark Sky Pictures and various others. In 2015 Kostbar partnered up at Sawhorse Productions (www.sawhorsela.com) Eben graduated Cum Laude from Frostburg State University.
biography.name: Eben Kostbar

biography.bio: Stephen Dodd is an actor, known for The Hammer (2010), The Aggression Scale (2012) and Signs of the Time (2008).
biography.name: Stephen Dodd

biography.bio: Joe Fiorie was born as Joseph A. Fiorie. He is an actor, known for The Aggression Scale (2012) and A Wife Alone (2012).
biography.name: Joe Fiorie

biography.bio: It looks like we don't have any Biography for Jill Burress yet.
biography.name: Jill Burress

biography.bio: Trevor Gross is an actor, known for The Aggression Scale (2012) and The Hammer (2010).
biography.name: Trevor Gross

biography.bio: Stephanie Sheak is an actress and set decorator, known for The Aggression Scale (2012), Mason Darby, He's Our Man! (2012) and King's Faith (2013).
biography.name: Stephanie Sheak

categories.category: Best Performance in a DVD Film - Young Actor
